text:
Q: 'git status' shows changed files, but 'git diff' doesn't A:

I stumbled upon this problem when I copied files into the repository to overwrite the previous versions. Now I can see the files are modified, but diff doesn't return the diffs.

For example, I have a mainpage.xaml file. In File Explorer I pasted a new mainpage.xaml file over the one in my current repository. I did the work on another machine and just pasted the file here.

The file shows modified, but when I run git diff, it will not show the changes.

It's probably because the fileinfo on the file has changed and Git knows that it isn't really the same file. Interesting.

You can see that when I run diff on the file it shows nothing, just returns the prompt.

Q: Cutting rows beginning with letter and past them after last cell of row beginning with number A:

This is an example in VBA. I set it up to target all cells in Sheet1 and store the results in Sheet2.

  • I have modified it to remove unnecessary rows. When you close and reopen the workbook, pressing Ctrl+End will take you to the last cell.

  • I revised it again.

    Previously, I was storing values while changing the size of the array, but it was hard to understand, so I changed it to loop twice. In the first loop, the array size is calculated, and in the second loop, the values are stored.

    The intermediate array expansion and the deletion of extra rows and columns at the end have been removed.

Sub ConbineCell()
    Dim i As Long
    Dim j As Long
    Dim r As Long
    Dim c As Long
    
    Dim wsSource As Worksheet
    Dim wsTarget As Worksheet
    Dim data As Variant
    Dim result As Variant
    Dim lngMode As Long
     ' add
    Dim maxCols As Long

    Set wsSource = Sheets("Sheet1")
    Set wsTarget = Sheets("Sheet2")
    
    ' Store the value of the cell in the array.
    data = wsSource.UsedRange.Value
    For lngMode = 0 To 1
        ' lngMode : 0  Calculate the size of the array
        '           1  Store the value in result.
        r = 0
        c = 1
        For i = 1 To UBound(data, 1)
            For j = 1 To UBound(data, 2)
                If Not IsEmpty(data(i, j)) Then
                    If IsNumeric(data(i, j)) Then
                        ' Since it's a number, start a new line
                        r = r + 1
                        c = 1
                    Else
                        If r = 0 Then
                            ' The first cell is not a number
                            MsgBox "The first cell is not a number"
                            Exit Sub
                        End If
                        c = c + 1
                    End If
                    If lngMode = 0 Then
                        ' Calculate the number of columns.
                        If maxCols < c Then
                            maxCols = c
                        End If
                    Else
                        ' Store values in the output array.
                        result(r, c) = data(i, j)
                    End If
                End If
            Next j
        Next i
        If lngMode = 0 Then
            If r = 0 Then
                Exit Sub
            End If
            ' Specify the size of the output array
            ReDim result(1 To r, 1 To maxCols)
        End If
    Next lngMode
    ' Write it back onto the worksheet.
    wsTarget.Cells.Clear
    wsTarget.Range("A1").Resize(UBound(result, 1), UBound(result, 2)).Value = result
End Sub

Q: What should be done if Git creates and pushes an empty merge commit, and how can it be reverted? A:

Problem:

You merged developer into dev_auto_routing_fn, but the merge commit failed repeatedly due to pre-commit hook errors(unused imports). In the end, an empty merge commit was created because you continued the merge without staging the fixed files. Git considers the branches merged, but the merge commit contains no file changes.

Why this happens:

  • Git allows empty merge commits because the merge itself has two parents and represents the branches being connected.

  • Pre-commit hooks don’t stop Git from creating an empty merge commit if nothing is staged.

  • An empty merge commit is valid and shows that the branches are merged, even if no content changed.

    Fixes:

    Option 1: Amend the empty merge commit to include your fixes

# 1. Stage the corrected files
git add path/to/fixed/files

# 2. Amend the previous merge commit
git commit --amend

# 3. Push changes (force required because history is rewritten)
git push --force origin dev_auto_routing_fn

Option 2: Add a separate commit with the fixes (safer for shared branches)

# 1. Stage your fixes
git add path/to/fixed/files

# 2. Create a normal commit
git commit -m "Fix unused imports after merge"

# 3. Push changes
git push origin dev_auto_routing_fn

Option 3: Reset and redo the merge (for a clean merge commit)

# Reset branch to before the merge
git reset --hard <commit-before-merge>

# Merge again
git merge developer

# Resolve conflicts and fix unused imports
git add .
git commit

Q: Can VS Code have a second activity bar? A:

You can get sort of close by dragging things into the secondary sidebar. You can find related commands in the command palette by searching "secondary side bar". It doesn't look exactly like the activity bar though, and you can't.

You're not going to find exactly this with VS Code vanilla. It was raised in a feature request, which was declined as out of scope: Add Activity Bar Support for Secondary Sidebar #195561. See this comment:

We closed this issue because we don't plan to address it in the foreseeable future. If you disagree and feel that this issue is crucial: we are happy to listen and to reconsider.

I can't say it's not possible for a UI customization to achieve this, but I think it would be a pretty difficult feat- especially if you wanted feature and behaviour parity.

Q: GitHub Error Message - Permission denied (publickey) A:

If you having issues to make connection with your enterprise Github account then follow the below steps

Solution #1

ERROR: git@github.com: Permission denied (public key). fatal: Could not read
from remote repository. Please make sure you have the correct access
rights

Solution (OSX)

  • Open your terminal and follow below commands

  • $ cd ~

  • $ sudo su

  • $ ssh-keygen

    • Enter file in which to save the key (/var/root/.ssh/id_rsa): $ id_rsa
    • Enter passphrase (empty for no passphrase): $ hit enter
    • Enter same passphrase again: $ hit enter

  • $ cd ~/.ssh (If your token created in root .ssh other wise cd where rsa created)

  • $ cat id_rsa.pub

  • copy display content.

  • Open GitHub click your profile icon settings>SSH and GPC Keys

  • Click on the new ssh key button

  • enter any title and key that you copied

  • check now your issue is resolved

Solution #2

ERROR 2: remote: Password authentication is not available for Git operations.
remote: You must use a personal access token or SSH key.
remote: See https://github.compnay.com/settings/tokens or https://github.compnay.com/settings/ssh
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.company.com/repo/app.git/': The requested URL returned an error: 403

Support for password authentication was removed on August 13, 2021. Please use a personal access token instead.

https://namespaceit.com/blog/remote-support-for-password-authentication-was-removed-on-august-13-2021-please-use-a-personal-access-token-instead

Q: ORA-01031(insufficient privilages) ORA-01501(create database failed) ORA-01100(database already mounted) A:

In WINDOWS

Control Panel\All Control Panel Items\Administrative Tools\Services

Here I restarted the following services:

*OracleServiceXE

*OracleXEClrAgent

And Oracle database 11g edition started working normally again. PS:Don't forget to restart the system
